<pb n="60"/>
<head>B:1967</head><lb/>
Printing and the Mind of Man: A Descriptive Catalogue Illustrating the Impact of Print on<lb/>
the Evolution of Western Civilization during Five Centuries.<lb/>
Edited by Carter and Percy H. Muir, assisted by Nicolas Barker, H.&nbsp;A. Feisenberger, Howard<lb/>
Nixon, and S.&nbsp;H. Steinberg; introduction by Denys Hay. London: Cassell; New York: Holt,<lb/>
Rinehart & Winston, 1967. xxxiv,280&nbsp;pp. Cloth, dust-jacket (different jackets for Britain and America).<lb/>
Printed by Cambridge University Press; designed by John Dreyfus, with title-page lettering engraved by Reynolds Stone.<lb/>
Muir’s set of proofs on which he identified the authorship of the commentaries is in Cambridge University Library.<lb/>
It indicates that Carter wrote the annotations for entries&nbsp;14 (Maimonides), 122 (Shakespeare Folio), 354 (<hi rend="italic">Alice in Wonderland</hi>), and 424 (Churchill’s speech of 20&nbsp;August&nbsp;1940)<lb/>
and that he collaborated with Muir on entries&nbsp;302 (Murray’s Travellers Guides), 351 (<hi rend="italic">Gettysburg Address</hi>), 373 (General William Booth’s <hi rend="italic">In Darkest England</hi>), and 403 (Frederick&nbsp;W. Taylor’s <hi rend="italic">The Principles of Scientific Management</hi>).<lb/>
As co-editor, Carter would have been involved in revising many of the other entries.<lb/>
Most of his papers relating to this project are in the Bodleian Library.<lb/>
For the catalogue of the 1963 exhibition out of which this book grew, see C:1963; for the advance “specimen” of this book, see B:1966; for Morison’s role, see C:1968.<lb/>
Revised (Pressler) subedition: Munich: Karl Pressler, 1983.<lb/>
With a new introduction by Muir and additional bibliographies by Peter Amelung.<lb/>
xxv,xxxiv,280&nbsp;pp. Cloth, dust-jacket, slip-case.<lb/>
German translation: <hi rend="italic">Bücher die die Welt verändern</hi>. Translated by Kurt Busse.<lb/>
Munich: Prestel, 1968. 789&nbsp;pp. Cloth, dust-jacket. Reprint: Darmstadt: Wissenschaftliche Buchgesellschaft, 1969. 789&nbsp;pp. Flexible fabric.<lb/>
Taschenbuch subedition: <hi rend="italic">Bücher die die Welt verändern: Eine Kulturgeschichte Europas in Büchern</hi>. Munich: Deutscher Taschenbuch, 1976. 789&nbsp;pp. Wrappers.<lb/>
Japanese translation: <hi rend="italic">Seiyo o kizuita shomotsu</hi>. Tokyo: Yushodo Shoten, 1977. lii,348&nbsp;pp. 5&nbsp;plates. Slip-case. Afterword by Hiroshi Tanabe.<lb/>
Catalogue of the Celebrated Collection Formed by Sir Maurice Pariser, of Manchester, of the Notorious Nineteenth Century Pamphlets and Other Important Wiseiana Manuscript and Printed.<lb/>
Compiled by Carter, with a “Preface” (pp.&nbsp;5–6). London: Sotheby’s, 4–5&nbsp;December&nbsp;1967. 139&nbsp;pp. Edition includes 25 copies on green paper. Unsigned.<lb/>
After-sale issue: With corrections and a list of buyers and prices bound in.<lb/>
For Carter’s account of the sale, see “Thomas&nbsp;J. Wise at Sotheby’s” (D:1968, January); see also E1:1967 (December).<lb/>
<head>B:1968</head><lb/>
A.&nbsp;E. Housman, <hi rend="italic">Housman’s Cambridge Inaugural: Inaugural Lecture as Kennedy Professor of Latin at Cambridge … Delivered May&nbsp;9, 1911</hi>.<lb/>
Edited by Carter, with a “Note.” London: Times Newspapers, [1968]. [3]&nbsp;pp. Limited to 25 copies “for private circulation,” printed by Bradbury Agnew Press.<lb/>
Reprinted from the <hi rend="italic">Times Literary Supplement</hi> of 9&nbsp;May&nbsp;1968 (E2:1968). For Carter’s published edition of the “complete text,” see the next entry.<lb/>
